result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Gus McCray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
- The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from any of the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined as a condition of extended supervision. 
- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 
- Restitution sets at zero. 
- Any amount remaining due an owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.

- The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/weapons. 
- The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

- No contact with the victim ATW or her family. 
- No alcohol or drugs to be monitored by random urine screens and breathalyzers.

- Sex Offender Evaluation and comply with any treatment. 
- Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Department. 
- Register as a sec offender for 15 years.

- AODA Assessment and comply with any treatment. 
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Gus McCray

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Gus McCray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced due to quarantine.  Defendant agrees to matter being heard by Zoom.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for -0- days time served.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to reconfinement.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
AODA Assessment and comply with any treatment.
Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or drugs to be monitored by random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Sex Offender Evaluation and comply with any treatment.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
No contact with victim ATW or her family.
The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from any of the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Restitution set at zero.
Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Department.
Register as a sex offender for 15 years.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon hemay not carry or possess any firearms/weapons.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights.  

FILED:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised Defendant as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm/weapon and he may not voted until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant remanded pending sentencing.   Jury Trial vacated.  DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY UNTIL THE SENTENCING DATE.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(34)(a), 939.50 (34)(g), a Class G Felony.  Defense waived reading and entered a temporary plea of not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and fled.  bm
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.  bm
Order to Produce signed and filed.  bm

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Demetrius Gus McCray not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in court for Status Conference.  Court waives Defendant's Appearance.  Parties advise Court they are still in negotiations.  Defense requesting Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Student Intern Kathleen Kruse under the supervision of Katie Ginsberg for Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense advises she has all discovery except the DNA results and requests a status date.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective P. Miner. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court, in person with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appears via Zoom.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Grant Huebner for Jack T Eichorst appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Gus McCray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for State v. Lee Hearing this date.  Attorney Kuehn has been appointed.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing March 30, 2022 at 1:30 pm
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray not in court, defendant in custody. Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with 
ATW (DOB: 12/27/2008)
ATW (DOB: 7/3/1971)
TLW (DOB: 2/28/83)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring for the no contact order monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Demetrius Gus McCray in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Gus McCray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
